featured.text: Maasai clothing varies with age, gender, and place.
The 10 bells vary in size, each 23 a name.
Today, all countries are involved in, and to varying degrees dependent on, trade with other countries.

The junk varies from tiny pieces of paint chipped off rockets to cameras, huge fuel tanks, and even odd items like the million-dollar tool kit that astronaut Heidemarie Stefanyshyn-Piper lost during a spacewalk.

other.text: Though the figures on attendance for each vary with every new season, certain 26 remain the same.
Americans __(38)__ different racial and educational backgrounds may vary in their standards of living.
The style of the dances varies from region to region but is normally based on the rhythms of taiko drums.

definition.en_def: To change or alter in form, appearance, or nature.
definition.example: The weather can vary greatly from one season to another.
